Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Pafolacianine in Intraoperative Molecular Imaging for Lung Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: randomly assigned to surgery with or without intraoperative molecular imaging using a 10:1 ratio

Participants.evidence: 112 patients with suspected or biopsy-confirmed lung cancer scheduled for sublobar pulmonary resection

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to surgery with or without intraoperative molecular imaging

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the clinical utility of pafolacianine

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the proportion of participants experiencing a clinically significant event

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed

Number_Randomised.evidence: 112 patients with suspected or biopsy-confirmed lung cancer

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 102 participants were analysed, with 92 in the intervention group and 10 in the control group, using an intention-to-treat approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: Clinically significant events occurred in 53% of participants, significantly exceeding the prespecified limit of 10% (P < .0001)

Harms.evidence: No drug-related serious adverse events were reported
